Summary Ge is an Assistant Professor at Stanford University in the Center for Computer Research in Music and Acoustics (CCRMA). His research interests include interactive software systems (of all sizes) for computer music, programming languages, mobile music, sound synthesis and analysis, new performance ensembles (e.g., laptop orchestras and mobile phone ensembles), visualization, interfaces for human-computer interaction, and methodologies for education at the intersection of computer science and music. 
 
Ge is the author of the ChucK audio programming language, and the founder and director of the Stanford Laptop Orchestra (SLOrk) and of the Stanford Mobile Phone Orchestra (MoPhO). Ge is also the Co-founder of Smule (reaching over 125 million users), and the designer of the iPhone's Ocarina and Magic Piano. 
 
http://www.gewang.com/ 
 
Specialties: computer music, interaction design, audio visual software design, programming language design, laptop orchestras, mobile music, visualization, research and teaching at the intersection of music, engineering, and design.

Summary Neurobiologist working on the relationship between the pathogenesis of Down syndrome and Alzheimer's disease. Has been involved in identifying neuronal networks that undergo significant degeneration in mouse models of Down syndrome and Alzheimer's disease. Currently, my group is working on the role of norepinephrine-ergic system in failed contextual learning in the Ts65Dn mouse model of Down syndrome. We are hoping that improving this system would restore cognitive function in children and reduce the severity of Alzheimer pathology in adults with Down syndrome. Summary Specialties:Neuro Opthalmology, Thyroid Eye Disease, Orbital Diseases Strabismus, Facial Plastics Summary Specialties:Neuro Opthalmology, Thyroid Eye Disease, Orbital Diseases Strabismus, Facial Plastics Specialties:Neuro Opthalmology, Thyroid Eye Disease, Orbital Diseases Strabismus, Facial Plastics Specialties:Neuro Opthalmology, Thyroid Eye Disease, Orbital Diseases Strabismus, Facial Plastics Experience Founder Let's Face It Together 2010  – Present (5 years) Let''s Face It Together was a dream for many years. The goal is to provide a resource for patients with medical issues to better navigate the complex medical system that exists in the US today. We are in the process of applying for grants that will fund medical and surgical care for patients without insurance or underinsured. Councilor American Academy of Ophthalmology 2007  – Present (8 years) I am currently the president of the California Academy of Eye Physicians and Surgeons and am serving in my fourth year as councilor with the AAO. At the April council meeting I introduced a resolution for the AAO to establish a task force to examine how ophthalmology can utlilize telemedicine to improve patient care in California and the rest of the US. Physician Owner Kimberly Cockerham, MD November 2006  – Present (8 years 10 months) Cockerham Eye Consultants was started in 2006 with the primary location in Los Altos. The primary location is now in both silicon valley and the central valley. Maps and locations are available on CockerhamMD.com Adjunct Clinical Associate Professor Stanford University Medical Center 2006  – Present (9 years) Palo Alto I really enjoying mentoring residents and coordinating the Plastics and Orbit section of the annual Bay Area Course in Ophthalmology at Stanford. 
 
While my clinical activities at the Palo Alto VA are limited, the returning blast injured veterans are so in need of evaluation and surgical reconstruction. The residents and I are honored to provide for their needs. Plastics-Orbit-Neuro-ophthalmology Palo Alto Veterans Health Care System 2006  –  2011  (5 years) Adjunct Associate Clinical Professor Stanford University Medical Center 2006  –  2010  (4 years) Ophthalmologist with subspecialty training in neuro-orbit and plastic reconstruction Blind and Vision Rehab Services 1992  –  2010  (18 years) This year, I celebrate my 25th anniversary of being an MD. The reunion is in September and I look forward to seeing my med school colleagues and reconnecting.  
 
I love what I do and am thrilled to be part of the Zeiter Eye Medical Group and helping to care for patients in the central valley of California. So many patients with serious needs - its very rewarding.  
 
I look forward to continuing to help train Stanford residents and to care for patients returning from Afghanistan within the Palo Alto VA system. 
 
Plastics-Orbit and Neuro-ophthalmology are just the right combination of medicine heavy and medicine not so serious. 
 
I am currently seeing patients in Silicon Valley in Cupertino - Dr. Chase Lay is terrific. I am also pairing with Diane and Balisimo and have launched a medspa on State Street that is great fun. 
 
But my heart and sole are dedicated to the patients of the central valley with my primary office now in Stockton with the Zeiter Eye Medical Group. 
 
Life is a great journey ! Experience Associate Professor Stanford University February 2012  – Present (3 years 7 months) I am a tenured Associate Professor in the Department of Radiation Oncology at Stanford University. My work consists of research on the use of molecular and functional imaging methods to monitor tumor progression and response to treatment, focusing on characterization of tumor radiobiology. I lead a research laboratory utilizing techniques including x-ray computed tomography, positron emission tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, bioluminescence and fluorescence imaging, and conformal radiotherapy.
